IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO CONNECT AND EQUIP SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO DELIVER QUALITY SUMMER LEARNING PROGRAMS TO OUR NATION'S YOUTH TO HELP CLOSE THE ACHIEVEMENT GAP.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO CONNECT AND EQUIP SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO DELIVER QUALITY SUMMER LEARNING PROGRAMS TO OUR NATION'S YOUTH TO HELP CLOSE THE ACHIEVEMENT GAP.
IRS990.Desc: TO PROVIDE RESOURCES FOR HIGH QUALITY SUMMER LEARNING PROGRAMS FOR YOUTH. THIS OBJECTIVE WAS ACCOMPLISHED BY PROVIDING RESEARCH AND BEST PRACTICES, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR EDUCATORS AND SUMMER LEARNING PROFESSIONALS, OUTREACH AND PUBLIC EDUCATION AND A VOICE FOR INCREASED PUBLIC INVESTMENT IN SUMMER LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NATIONAL SUMMER LEARNING ASSOCIATION, INC. (NSLA) ACCOUNTS FOR THE EFFECT OF ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS BASED ON A "MORE LIKELY THAN NOT" THRESHOLD TO THE RECOGNITION OF THE TAX POSITIONS BEING SUSTAINED BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION UNDER SCRUTINY BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING AUTHORITY. IF A TAX POSITION OR POSITIONS ARE DEEMED TO RESULT IN UNCERTAINTIES OF THOSE POSITIONS, THE UNRECOGNIZED TAX EFFECT IS ESTIMATED BASED ON A "CUMULATIVE PROBABILITY ASSESSMENT" THAT AGGREGATES THE ESTIMATED TAX LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. INTEREST AND PENALTIES, IF ANY, ARE ACCRUED AS A COMPONENT OF GENERAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES WHEN ASSESSED. NSLA IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND CLASSIFIED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AS OTHER THAN A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. SIMILAR TO OTHER TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS, NSLA IS SUBJECT TO TAX ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. TAX YEARS ENDED PRIOR TO JUNE 30, 2019 ARE NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO EQUIP THE COMMUNITY WITH SUMMER EDUCATION PROGRAMS
TO EQUIP THE COMMUNITY WITH SUMMER EDUCATION PROGRAMS
TO EQUIP THE COMMUNITY WITH SUMMER EDUCATION PROGRAMS
TO ESTABLISH THE 2022 SUMMER INNOVATION FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM
TO ESTABLISH THE 2022 SUMMER INNOVATION FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM
TO EQUIP THE COMMUNITY WITH SUMMER EDUCATION PROGRAMS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GRANT RECIPIENTS WERE CHOSEN THROUGH A MULTI-ROUND EVALUATION PROCESS WHICH CONSISTED OF REVIEWING APPLICATIONS TO THE PROGRAMS, HISTORY, LOCATION, IN-PERSON PROGRAM EVALUATION, AND INTERVIEWS. AN ORGANIZATION WAS USED TO COORDINATE THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM, WHICH REPRESENTS SOME OF THE AWARDS ON THIS SCHEDULE. THERE WERE NO FORMAL GRANT REPORTING REQUIREMENTS RELATED TO THESE AWARDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS' FINANCE COMMITTEE, PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE ALSO COVERED UNDER THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ANY CONFLICTS ARE BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE BOARD AND THE BOARD ADDRESSES THE SITUATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS FORMED A CEO REVIEW COMMITTEE TO ANNUALLY MEET AND REVIEW THE PREVIOUS YEAR RESULTS IN ANTICIPATION OF THE CEO COMPENSATION FOR THE ENSUING FISCAL YEAR. THE COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF THE PRESIDENT AND TWO OTHER BOARD MEMBERS WHO ARE INVOLVED IN THE NON-PROFIT SECTOR. THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL USE A REVIEW OF OTHER SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS AND NON-PROFITS ALONG FOR THE GUIDANCE IN SETTING THE SALARIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS A COMMITTE THAT ASSUMES THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSEEING THE AUDIT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PREVIOUS YEARS.
